Bill Name: SR 15/16-076 Equal Pay for all Chief Appointed Officers
SR 15/16-094 Enacting a Bylaw to manage Socially Responsible Financial Practices
SR 15/16-095 A Resolution To Recognize the Sikh Genocide of 1984 and Push for Education about Sikh Hxstory
SR 15/16-096 Resolution in Support of Action Items to Combat Islamophobia
SR 16/17-043 In Support of the 2007 UC System-wide policy for Addressing Religious Holiday Conflicts: Accommodation of Muslim Religious Holidays
SR 16/17-081 In Support of Transportation Subsidies for FPF Students
SR 16/17-082 In Support of Inclusive On-Campus Food Options
SR 17/18-017 Indicating Specific Concerns with the “Interim Policy on Major Events Hosted by Non-departmental Users” & Outlining Suggestions to Increase Equitability
SR 17/18-038 Urging the University to make November 6, 2018 a Voting Holiday to Encourage Student Engagement in the 2018 Midterm Elections
SR 17/18-055 Implementation of Stricter Misconduct/Harassment Prevention Policies for Elected/Appointed Officials and Electoral Candidates
SR 17/18-086 Creating Sexual Violence & Sexual Harassment Prevention Education and Response Protocols for Registered Student Organizations
SR 17/18-087 In Support of AFSCME’s Contract Demands
SR 18/19-006 In Support of the "Affordable Housing Act" (Proposition 10)
Notes: Endorses the state of California's Affordable Housing Act (Proposition 10)

Bill Name: SR 18/19-011 In Support of United Against Hate Week
Notes: Supports United Against Hate Week and its annual programming

Bill Name: SR 18/19-012 In Support of Measure P
Notes: Pulled from agenda because ASUC had already endorsed Measure P

Bill Name: SR 18/19-013 In Support of Measure Q
Notes: Endorses the Amendments to the Rent Stabilization and Eviction for Good Cause Ordinance (Measure Q)

Bill Name: SR 18/19-020 In Support of Making the ACT & SAT Requirement Optional for UC Admissions
Notes: Endorses the University of California adopting an ACT and SAT optional policy for undergraduate admissions

Bill Name: SR 18/19-044 In Support of Ratifying Revisions to the UCSA Charter
Notes: Ratifies the October 2018 UCSA charter amendment

Bill Name: SR 18/19-055 In Opposition to Single Family Zoning
Notes: Opposes single-family zoning in the City of Berkeley because of affordability, sustainability, and racial equity concerns

Bill Name: SR 18/19-056 In Support of the Green Affordable Housing Package
Notes: Supports the Green Affordable Housing Package, prioritizing dwelling units over parking spaces

Bill Name: SR 18/19-045 Demanding the Establishment of a University Fund for Health Emergencies
Notes: Supports creation of a university fund for health emergencies, supports student input on the fee's allocation committee, advises the University revisit the Emergency Operations Policy

Bill Name: SR 18/19-052 In Support of the City of Berkeley “Sanctuary City Contracting and Investment Ordinance”
Notes: Supports the City of Berkeley's "Sanctuary City Contracting and Investment Ordinance"

Bill Name: SR 18/19-057 Demanding the University to Provide Exam Accommodations in Ramadan
Notes: Urges professors to accomodate exam times for students fasting for Ramadan, demand for creation of Chancellor’s Advisory Committee on Muslim Student Life & Campus Climate

Bill Name: SR18/19-087 In Support of the Creation of a SSWANA Residence Hall Program
Notes: Supports the creation of SSWANA Theme Program and urges the Division of Student Affairs, SSWANA Initiative, APASD and Residence Hall Association to secure enough funding, support, and staff

Bill Name: SR 19/20-002 Condemning the Government of India for the Revocation Articles 370 and 35a
Notes: Condemns the Indian Government for stripping Jammu and Kashmir of its sovereignty and for human rights violations

Bill Name: SR 19/20-008 Allocating Contingency Funds for the 2019-2020 Year
Notes: Reallocates $30,000 from the Capital Improvement Fund and $61,000 from the Emergency Legal Defense Fund, for a total of $91,000, to the Contingency Fund

Bill Name: SR 19/20-024 In Support of Demanding the University to Expand the Number of Mental Health Resources on Syllabi
Notes: Supports the inclusion of mental health on syllabi along with repeated reminders about said resources over the course of the semester

Bill Name: SR 20/21-011 In Support of the Creation of a MEMSSA - SSWANA Resource Center
Notes: Asks the ASUC to recognize and declare support for the opening of the MEMSSA - SSWANA Resource Center in order to enhance resources or services to the greater community at large

Bill Name: SR 20/21-017 In support of the Creation of a Standardized Code for the Use and Management of Religious Texts in Libraries
Notes: Asks the ASUC to call upon all UC Berkeley libraries that contain religious texts, scripture, hymns, and recordings to be handled and treated with the utmost respect and care, and to author a recommended standardized code for handling.

Bill Name: SR 20/21-038  For the Creation of a Position under the Office of the ASUC Chief Personnel Officer to Support Implementation of ASUC Senate Legislation
SR 20/21-039 In Support of Extending the University of California Application Deadline for the 2021-2022 Admissions Cycle
Notes: Asks the ASUC to help with extending the application deadline from November 30, 2020 until at least December 15, 2020.

Bill Name: SR 20/21-058 Amending ASUCBL 1201 for the Addition of a “Primary Author” Subheading to ASUC Senate Motions
SR 20/21-066 Daily Cal Initiative
Notes: Asks the ASUC to place the question, titled “The Daily Cal Initiative”, on the ballot for the 2021 ASUC General Elections, asking if the students approve the $6 semesterly and $2.50 per summer fee.

Bill Name: SR 20/21-069 Allocating Funds to Create More Accessible Facilities by Working Towards Renovating Basement Floor Bathrooms of Eshleman Hall
Notes: Asks the ASUC to allocate fund($15,000) for renovating the three restrooms located on the basement floor of Eshleman Hall

Bill Name: SR 21/22-013 In Solidarity with the People of Afghanistan
Notes: Asks the ASUC to stand in support of the Afghan people under the oppression of Taliban rule

Bill Name: SR 21/22-022 Calling for Cogent Data on Disability Studies and ASUC Implementation of Disability Education and Awareness
Notes: Calls on cmapus administration to improve data intake regarding information about disabled students, and recognize the importance and needs of disabled students on campus year-round

Bill Name: SR 21/22-048 Calling for Ecological and Environmental Action to Address the Growing Population at UC Berkeley
SR 21/22-058 In Support of Seamless Transit Transformation Act SB 917
Notes: Asks the ASUC to endorse the Seamless Transit Transformation Act
